metadata.title: CVE-2019-0154 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient access control in subsystem for Intel (R) processor graphicsin 6th, 7th, 8th and 9th Generation Intel(R) Core(TM) Processor Families;Intel(R) Pentium(R) Processor J, N, Silver and Gold Series; Intel(R)Celeron(R) Processor J, N, G3900 and G4900 Series; Intel(R) Atom(R)Processor A and E3900 Series; Intel(R) Xeon(R) Processor E3-1500 v5 and v6and E-2100 Processor Families may allow an authenticated user topotentially enable denial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-4.4.0-168-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-168-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1126-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1126.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1130-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1130.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1098-aws - 4.4.0-1098.109
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-69-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-69-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-69-lowlatency - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-69-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-69-lowlatency - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1063-azure - 4.15.0-1063.68
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1049-gcp - 4.15.0-1049.52
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1062-kvm - 4.4.0-1062.69

No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1126.135').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.138').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.109').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.68').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1049.52').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.69').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1').
